name: GetTerminalReaders
description:
Retrieve a list of terminal reader objects.

Use this tool to obtain a list of Stripe terminal readers. It is useful when you need to manage or view details of connected terminal devices.

parameters.name: filter_by_device_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of device to filter terminal readers. Options include: 'bbpos_chipper2x', 'bbpos_wisepad3', 'bbpos_wisepos_e', 'mobile_phone_reader', 'simulated_stripe_s700', 'simulated_wisepos_e', 'stripe_m2', 'stripe_s700', 'verifone_P400'.

parameters.name: pagination_cursor_ending_before
parameters.description: A cursor for pagination, used to fetch the previous page based on object ID.

value_schema.description: A cursor for use in pagination. `ending_before` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with `obj_bar`, your subsequent call can include `ending_before=obj_bar` in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

parameters.name: expand_response_fields
parameters.description: List of fields to expand in the response, specified as strings.

value_schema.description: Specifies which fields in the response should be expanded.

parameters.name: object_return_limit
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of terminal reader objects to return, ranging from 1 to 100. Default is 10.

value_schema.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 10.

parameters.name: filter_by_location_id
parameters.description: Specify the location ID to filter readers to a specific location only.

value_schema.description: A location ID to filter the response list to only readers at the specific location

parameters.name: filter_by_serial_number
parameters.description: Provide a serial number to filter the list of terminal readers by this specific serial number.

parameters.name: pagination_start_object_id
parameters.description: The object ID used as a cursor to define your starting point in the list for pagination, fetching the next page.

value_schema.description: A cursor for use in pagination. `starting_after` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with `obj_foo`, your subsequent call can include `starting_after=obj_foo` in order to fetch the next page of the list.

parameters.name: filter_by_status
parameters.description: Filter terminal readers by their status, either 'offline' or 'online'.

value_schema.description: A status filter to filter readers to only offline or online readers

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Stripe API.
